comments:
The ChangeSummary.getOldValues(DataObject) will throw an NullPointerException
when there are objects created after ChangeSummary.beginLogging();

Example:
changeSummary.beginLogging();
DataObject addr = employee.createDataObject("address"); // the address is
containment
...

changeSummary.endLogging();

changeSummary.getOldContainer(anotherDataObject);

it will result in following exception:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.change.impl.ChangeDescriptionImpl.getOldContainmentInformation(ChangeDescriptionImpl.java:356)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.change.impl.ChangeDescriptionImpl.getOldContainer(ChangeDescriptionImpl.java:371)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.impl.EChangeSummaryImpl.getOldContainer(EChangeSummaryImpl.java:316)
	...

The problem is in the getOldContainmentInformation() of ChangeDescriptionImpl class:
              EObject eObject = (EObject)featureChange.getValue();
              if (eObject.eContainer() != container ||
eObject.eContainmentFeature() != feature)
              {
                oldContainmentInformation.put(eObject, new
OldContainmentInformation(container, (EReference)feature));
              }
Note the eObject may be null when there are containment objects been created
after beginLogging(), but there is no checking for null value, and the
NullPointerException will been thrown.

The fix to check for null has been committed to CVS.  It also now properly
ensures that the old container is null for objects newly added to the data graph.
